Event.title: Event
Event.description: Represents a single event for which users can register, including its thematic and logistical details.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Event entity.

title.description: The title or name of the event.

description.description: A detailed description of the event, potentially enhanced by AI content generation.

startDate.description: The date and time when the event begins.

endDate.description: The date and time when the concludes.

location.description: The physical or virtual location where the event will take place.

themeColorPrimary.description: The primary brand color for the event's unique UI theme (e.g., hex code #002E3C).

themeColorAccent.description: The accent color for highlighting key elements in the event's UI theme (e.g., hex code #FFD700).

themeColorBackground.description: The background color for the event's UI theme (e.g., hex code #E0F4F7).

headlineFont.description: The name of the font family used for headlines on the event page (e.g., 'Space Grotesk').

bodyFont.description: The name of the font family used for body text on the event page (e.g., 'Inter').

graphicsUrl.description: URL to custom graphics or a banner image for the event's page, contributing to its unique theme.

gdprInformation.description: GDPR specific information and consent text tailored for this particular event's registration process.

isActive.description: A flag indicating whether the event page is currently active and visible to the public for registration.

requiresApproval.description: A flag indicating if registrations for this event require manual approval by an organizer.

registrationDeadline.description: The date and time by which attendees must complete their registration for the event.

maxAttendees.description: The maximum number of participants allowed to register for the event. (Optional)

organizerContactEmail.description: The primary email address for event organizers to receive inquiries.

EventFormField.title: EventFormField
EventFormField.description: Defines the structure and validation rules for a single dynamic field within an event's registration form.

id.description: Unique identifier for the EventFormField entity.

eventId.description: Reference to the Event this form field is associated with. (Relationship: Event 1:N EventFormField)

fieldName.description: The internal, programmatic name for the form field (e.g., 'fullName', 'email', 'companyName').

fieldType.description: The type of input field to render (e.g., 'text', 'email', 'number', 'textarea', 'checkbox', 'radio', 'select').

label.description: The human-readable label displayed next to the form field on the UI.

placeholder.description: Optional placeholder text displayed within the form field before user input.

isRequired.description: A flag indicating whether this form field must be filled out by the registrant.

validationRegex.description: An optional regular expression string used to validate the input for this field.

options.description: A list of predefined string options for field types like 'select', 'radio', or 'checkbox'.

order.description: The numerical order in which this field should appear within the registration form.

Registration.title: Registration
Registration.description: Records a single user's registration for a specific event, storing all submitted dynamic form data.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Registration entity.

eventId.description: Reference to the Event for which the user registered. (Relationship: Event 1:N Registration)

registrationDate.description: The date and time when the user successfully completed the registration.

formData.description: An array of objects, where each object represents a submitted field from the dynamic form, storing its fieldName and fieldValue.

checkedIn.description: Indicates if the attendee has checked in to the event.

checkInTime.description: The timestamp when the attendee checked in.

isApproved.description: Indicates if the registration has been approved by an organizer.

definition.description: Collection storing the UIDs of global application administrators. The document ID is the user's UID, and the document itself can be empty or a minimal placeholder. Used for Database-Backed Access Control (DBAC) to grant global administrative privileges.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier (UID) of the administrative user.

definition.description: Top-level collection for all events. Each document represents a single event. Documents in this collection MUST include an 'ownerId' field (string, the UID of the event creator/primary organizer) and a 'members' map (object, e.g., {'uid': 'role'}) for collaborative access control. The 'isActive' field dictates public visibility. Includes denormalized 'ownerId' and 'members' map for authorization independence.

params.name: eventId
params.description: The unique identifier for the event.

definition.description: Subcollection defining the dynamic form fields for a specific event's registration form. Each document represents a single form field. Documents in this subcollection MUST include denormalized 'eventId' (string), 'eventOwnerId' (string), 'eventMembers' (map), and 'eventIsActive' (boolean) from the parent Event document for robust authorization independence and public listability checks.

params.name: eventId
params.description: The unique identifier of the parent event.

params.name: formFieldId
params.description: The unique identifier for the form field.

definition.description: Subcollection storing individual user registrations for a specific event. Each document represents one completed registration. Documents in this subcollection MUST include denormalized 'eventId' (string), 'eventOwnerId' (string), and 'eventMembers' (map) from the parent Event document for secure, organizer-only access and authorization independence. The 'formData' field is an ordered array of submitted string values, interpreted based on the corresponding EventFormField's 'order'.

params.name: eventId
params.description: The unique identifier of the parent event.

params.name: registrationId
params.description: The unique identifier for the registration.
